title: Alessandro Zito
text:
Highlights
In my research, I work towards having easy-to-use software that can be useful to scientists in my field as well as in others. Below is a list of tutorials for packages I developed in parallel with some of my projects.


R-packages











BayesANT - BAYESiAn Nonparametric Taxonomic classifier
BayesANT is a DNA barcoding algorithm to classify DNA sequences within a hierarchical taxonomy, while allowing novel species to be discovered in the test set. See Zito, Rigon, Dunson (2023) MEE.
GitHub Tutorial















BNPvegan - Bayesian nonparametric methods for ecologists
BNPvegan is an R-package that implements the methods described in Zito, Rigon, Ovaskainen and Dunson (2023) JASA
GitHub Tutorial















ConjugateDP - random number generator for the Stirling-gamma distribution
ConjugateDP is an R-package that implements the random sampler for the Stirling-gamma distribution, which is the conjugate prior for the Dirichlet process precision parameter. See methods described in Zito, Rigon, Dunson (2024+) arXiv
GitHub















CompressiveNMF - Bayesian non-negative matrix factorization for mutational signature analysis
This repo contains the code to reproduce the empirical results in Zito and Miller (2024+) arXiv
GitHub






Other projects











Proximity - Pareto optimal proxy metrics
This repo contains the code to reproduce the empirical results in Richarson et al. (2023), arXiv
Property of Google LLC :)

title: Alessandro Zito
text:
I sam strongly motivated by application, which serves as a base for developing new statistical methodologies. My goal is to create simple yet effective methods that are theoretically justified and useful to practitioners who need to draw scientific conclusion.
Mys current line of work involves improving on Bayesian non-negative matrix factorization algorithms, with a strong emphasis on cancer genomics and mutational signatures analysis.
During my Ph.D. at Duke, I developed Bayesian nonparametric methodologies under the supervision of Professor David Dunson within Project LIFEPLAN, an international research group whose aim is to quantify biodiversity across the globe.
Ph.D. Dissertation Ph.D. defense slides Google Scholar

title: Alessandro Zito
text:
Welcome to my website!
I am a Postdoctoral research fellow in Biostatistics at the Harvard T.H. Chan School of Public Health, where I am supervised by Professor Jeffrey W. Miller and Professor Giovanni Parmigiani.
I obtained my Ph.D. in Statistical Science at Duke University, in North Carolina. Prior to living in the United States in 2019, I studied Economics at Bocconi University, in Milan, Italy.
My curriculum vitae is available here. A complete list of publications is available here.
E-mail - azito@hsph.harvard.edu
Research interests - Bayesian statistics, Bayesian nonparametrics, Bioinformatics, Cancer genomics, Factor models, Mutational signature analysis.



[August 2024] My postdoc advisor Jeff Miller will be presenting Compressive Bayesian non-negative matrix factorization for mutational signature analysis at the IMS conference in Berlin.
[July 2024] I presented my work Bayesian nonparametric modeling of latent partitions via Stirling-gamma priors (poster) and Compressive Bayesian non-negative matrix factorization for mutational signature analysis (talk) at the ISBA world meeting 2024. ISBA is the main international conference fro Bayesian statistics.
